FuncDef:
The deny command denies service flows that match a specified rule.
The permit command configures the device to forward the packets matching the rule according to the original policy without performing any action.
The undo command restores the default configuration. The deny command denies service flows that match a specified rule. The permit command configures the device to forward the packets matching the rule according to the original policy without performing any action. The undo command restores the default configuration. By default, the permit command is used to forward packets matching traffic classification rules according to the original policy.
ExtraInfo: The device implements access control using a traffic policy. That is, you can use a traffic policy containing deny | permit on the device so that the device provides the firewall function to filter out specified types of packets. The deny | permit command only filters data packets, but does not process control packets sent to the CPU.
